meanings.definition: To make a soft, rushing sound.
meanings.sent1: The wind was shooshing through the trees.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the shooshing of the waves at the beach.
meanings.sent3: The shooshing of the river sounded like a lullaby.
meanings.sent4: Her dress swished, shooshing softly as she walked.
meanings.sent5: The shooshing of the waterfall was calming.

meanings.definition: To quiet or silence someone or something by making a shushing sound.
meanings.sent1: She was shooshing the noisy children in the library.
meanings.sent2: The teacher shooshed the class before the test.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried shooshing the barking dog with a meow.
meanings.sent4: The audience shooshed the loud talker during the movie.
meanings.sent5: He shooshed his friend to keep the secret quiet.
